alert.note: Alert for Bradley; East Polk; McMinn; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 11:55PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL CHEROKEE...EAST CENTRAL BRADLEY...POLK...SOUTHEASTERN MCMINN AND SOUTHWESTERN MONROE COUNTIES THROUGH 130 AM EST... At 1255 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Benton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Benton, Etowah, Coker Creek, Mount Vernon, Parksville, Turtletown, Bullet Creek, Reliance, Archville, and Hiwassee Ocoee State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EST for east Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Bradley; East Polk; McMinn; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe; West Polk
